  <div id="container">
    <div class="docs markdown"><div class="pilwrap" id="recharts">
  <h1>
    <a href="#recharts" name="recharts" class="pilcrow"></a>
Recharts
  </h1>
</div>
<p><a href="https://recharts.github.io/en-US/storybook"><img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/storybooks/brand/master/badge/badge-storybook.svg" alt="storybook"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/recharts/recharts/actions"><img src="https://github.com/recharts/recharts/workflows/Node.js%20CI/badge.svg" alt="Build Status"></a>
<a href="https://codecov.io/gh/recharts/recharts"><img src="https://codecov.io/gh/recharts/recharts/graph/badge.svg?token=Bn6L2hrl8T" alt="codecov"></a>
<a href="http://badge.fury.io/js/recharts"><img src="https://badge.fury.io/js/recharts.svg" alt="npm version"></a>
<a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/recharts"><img src="https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/recharts.svg?style=flat-square" alt="npm downloads"></a>
<a href="/LICENSE.html"><img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-blue.svg?style=flat" alt="MIT License"></a></p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="introduction">
  <h2>
    <a href="#introduction" name="introduction" class="pilcrow"></a>
Introduction
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Recharts is a <strong>Redefined</strong> chart library built with <a href="https://facebook.github.io/react/">React</a> and <a href="http://d3js.org">D3</a>.</p>
<p>The main purpose of this library is to help you to write charts in React applications without any pain. Main principles of Recharts are:</p>
<ol>
<li><strong>Simply</strong> deploy with React components.</li>
<li><strong>Native</strong> SVG support, lightweight with minimal dependencies.</li>
<li><strong>Declarative</strong> components.</li>
</ol>
<p>Documentation at <a href="https://recharts.github.io">recharts.github.io</a> and our <a href="https://recharts.github.io/en-US/storybook">storybook</a></p>
<p>Also see <a href="https://github.com/recharts/recharts/wiki">the wiki</a>.</p>
<p>All development is done on the <code>main</code> branch. The current latest release and storybook documentation reflects what is on the <code>release</code> branch.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="examples">
  <h2>
    <a href="#examples" name="examples" class="pilcrow"></a>
Examples
  </h2>
</div>
<pre><code class="jsx">&lt;LineChart width={400} height={400} data={data}&gt;
  &lt;XAxis dataKey="name" /&gt;
  &lt;Tooltip /&gt;
  &lt;CartesianGrid stroke="#f5f5f5" /&gt;
  &lt;Line type="monotone" dataKey="uv" stroke="#ff7300" /&gt;
  &lt;Line type="monotone" dataKey="pv" stroke="#387908" /&gt;
&lt;/LineChart&gt;
</code></pre>
<p>All the components of Recharts are clearly separated. The LineChart is composed of x axis, tooltip, grid, and line items, and each of them is an independent React Component. The clear separation and composition of components is one of the principle Recharts follows.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="installation">
  <h2>
    <a href="#installation" name="installation" class="pilcrow"></a>
Installation
  </h2>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="npm">
  <h3>
    <a href="#npm" name="npm" class="pilcrow"></a>
npm
  </h3>
</div>
<p>NPM is the easiest and fastest way to get started using Recharts. It is also the recommended installation method when building single-page applications (SPAs). It pairs nicely with a CommonJS module bundler such as Webpack.</p>
<pre><code class="sh"><span class="hljs-comment"># latest stable</span>
$ npm install recharts react-is
</code></pre>
<p><code>react-is</code> needs to match the version of your installed <code>react</code> package.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="umd">
  <h3>
    <a href="#umd" name="umd" class="pilcrow"></a>
umd
  </h3>
</div>
<p>The UMD build is also available on unpkg.com:</p>
<pre><code class="html"><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">script</span> <span class="hljs-attr">src</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"https://unpkg.com/react/umd/react.production.min.js"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">script</span>&gt;</span>
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">script</span> <span class="hljs-attr">src</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"https://unpkg.com/react-dom/umd/react-dom.production.min.js"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">script</span>&gt;</span>
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">script</span> <span class="hljs-attr">src</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"https://unpkg.com/react-is/umd/react-is.production.min.js"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">script</span>&gt;</span>
<span class="hljs-tag">&lt;<span class="hljs-name">script</span> <span class="hljs-attr">src</span>=<span class="hljs-string">"https://unpkg.com/recharts/umd/Recharts.min.js"</span>&gt;</span><span class="hljs-tag">&lt;/<span class="hljs-name">script</span>&gt;</span>
</code></pre>
<p>Then you can find the library on <code>window.Recharts</code>.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="contributing">
  <h2>
    <a href="#contributing" name="contributing" class="pilcrow"></a>
Contributing
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Recharts is open source. If you want to contribute to the project, please read the <a href="/CONTRIBUTING.md.html">CONTRIBUTING.md</a>
to understand how to contribute to the project and <a href="/DEVELOPING.md.html">DEVELOPING.md</a> to set up your development
environment.</p>
